p: Anopheles A virus (ANAV) and Anopheles B virus (ANBV) were first isolated from female An. boliviensis in Colombia. Mice injected with ANAV and ANBV displayed central nervous system pathologies [ 30], although these viruses have not been isolated from naturally-infected vertebrates. An. boliviensis is a minor malaria vector in Colombia [ 108]. ANAV and ANBV are distinct from other Bunyamwera viruses because the S segment encodes only the nucleocapsid protein N, and therefore the nonstructural protein (NSs) involved in replication and pathogenesis is absent [ 109, 110, 111].
